Description: Spear with a steel blade, and a bamboo shaft with the butt shod by a heavy piece of iron with thin strips of iron wound round the handle.
Curator's comments: Christy slip: "Bari. Shilluk. Central Africa. From Mr Petherick's collection". See John Petherick, Egypt, the Soudan and Central Africa, 1861, p.353: (on the Shillook) ‘Their arms consist of a club and a long iron lance with a slightly pliable wooden handle, beautifully balanced by a stout iron wire wound round its extremity.’
